main event: An observer reported seeing an orange brilliant round object descending to about 100 feet above ground, hovering for a few seconds, and then ascending rapidly before disappearing to the south on 29 March 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as orange and brilliant., The sighting lasted about 5 seconds., The observer reported that the object hovered briefly before ascending., There was a previous sighting of a green oblong object noted on 30 March 1955., The conclusion in both reports was 'possible meteor'.
